page.title: 12Home Life in Glenisla.
page.content:
Michael's Day
Dad gets up at 6 a.m. and gets dressed. He puts on his outdoor clothes,picks up the milk pail and collects Jenny the cow from the field.He milks her and when he comes back we all have our breakfast together. We always have toast and a buttery. Dad then collects our two sheepdogs, Queen and Bob, and they walk round the fields checking the sheep. My job is to feed the pet lambs by hand with made-up powdered milk. My sister and I go to the road end to wait for the school bus. My sister attends the Secondary School in Kirriemuir which is thirteen miles away and I travel three and a half miles to the local Glenisla Primary School. When I arrive I play with my friends until the bell rings .
